p.s: In the following, I am going to comment on WaltersWalter's and the other Youngers' dreams in the context of the American Dream and African American history.

When Mama says that Walter has almost lost his mind thinking about money all the time, she isn't wrong at all, because Walter does really invest an amount of time into his idea with the liquor store, but the other family members are thinking and planingplanning with the money too, because they just need the money.

At all the American Dream is a phenomenon about that you can do everything what you want, no matter who you are of what your background is like, like if you are white or black, which relegionreligion do you have or if you are small or tall.
The only thing you have to belivebelieve in is your own work and for what you do work.
But when the slavery offical ended, the descriminationdiscrimination of black people still havehas not ended.

They were humans second class, like in buses they had to be seperatedseparated, in restaurant they had to be seperatedseparated and even in the rest roomsrestrooms they had to be seperatedseparated from the white people.
Black people do not had the same rights as the white people, although white people made the law that everyone would be the same.
The problem was that these people who made the laws, were racist from the beginning, so racism is a problem which is there for some hundred years now.
The things which the Younger family wants to do with the cash are things everyone should be able to get, with or without the money.
But because of the African American history, they have real struggles archievingachieving things as the whites.
I think Walter has the best plan with the money, because he is looking for an income for more than just a few months.
He wants his family to be financial stable for a long time, while Travis, Mama and Ruth want a better house.
Quite a good idea, but they will have the same income and the same living conditions after buying the house, so it wouldn't be that smart to buy a house.
And Beneatha want'swants to become a graduated doctor, which is quite hard as a black woman in the 20 decade.
But one importimportant thing which makes all these plans and dreams the same, is that they are kind of American Dreams.
And itsit's their good right to get a better life.
